properties.displayName: _CSGP: AWS CloudTrail - Possible Instance User Data Command Execution-Medium
properties.description:
Detects when an ec2 instance is stopped prior to having its user-data modified. This could allow an attacker to obtain arbitrary code execution using the instance's credentials/access.

Handling guidance: Reach out to the associated user / team (if applicable) and find their use-case. Confirm with secops that this is authorized and expected. This shouldn't fire very often as people should typically be terminating/relaunching their instances rather than simple start/stopping.
properties.query:
//Contributor: Jeremy Kesterson
//Reference:  https://hackingthe.cloud/aws/exploitation/local-priv-esc-mod-instance-att/
//Description: Detects when an ec2 instance is stopped prior to having its user-data modified. This could allow an attacker to obtain arbitrary code execution using the instance's credentials/access.
//Handling guidance: Reach out to the associated user / team (if applicable) and find their use-case. Confirm with secops that this is authorized and expected. This shouldn't fire very often as people should typically be terminating/relaunching their instances rather than simple start/stopping.
let UserDataMods = (
AWSCloudTrail
| where TimeGenerated > ago(20m)
| where EventName == 'ModifyInstanceAttribute'
| extend RequestParams = parse_json(RequestParameters)
| where tostring(RequestParams.userData) != ''
| extend instanceId = tostring(RequestParams.instanceId)
);
AWSCloudTrail
| where TimeGenerated > ago(20m)
| where EventName == 'StopInstances'
| extend RequestParams = parse_json(RequestParameters)
| extend instance_list = RequestParams.instancesSet.items
| mv-expand instance_list
| extend instanceId = tostring(parse_json(instance_list).instanceId)
| join UserDataMods on $left.instanceId == $right.instanceId
| where TimeGenerated1 > TimeGenerated
| join kind=inner _GetWatchlist('aws-accounts') on $left.UserIdentityAccountId == $right.accountid
| extend AccountName = name
| extend UserIdentity = split(UserIdentityArn, '/')[2]
| project name, TimeGenerated, EventName, UserIdentityArn, RecipientAccountId, AWSRegion, instanceId, TimeGenerated1, EventName1, UserIdentityArn1, RecipientAccountId1, instanceId1, SourceIpAddress, SourceIpAddress1
